comments:
Build ID: I20070209-1006

Steps To Reproduce:
Happens after some time on 3.3m5. Restart fixes it temporarily.

More information:
Stack trace:

!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Searching for all types".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String cannot be cast to org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.indexing.IndexManager.computeIndexLocation(IndexManager.java:129)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.IndexSelector.initializeIndexLocations(IndexSelector.java:128)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.IndexSelector.getIndexLocations(IndexSelector.java:203)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.JavaSearchParticipant.selectIndexes(JavaSearchParticipant.java:112)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.PatternSearchJob.getIndexes(PatternSearchJob.java:80)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.PatternSearchJob.ensureReadyToRun(PatternSearchJob.java:51)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.performConcurrentJob(JobManager.java:177)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.BasicSearchEngine.searchAllTypeNames(BasicSearchEngine.java:777)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.search.SearchEngine.searchAllTypeNames(SearchEngine.java:780)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.dialogs.TypeInfoViewer$SearchEngineJob.getSearchResult(TypeInfoViewer.java:669)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.dialogs.TypeInfoViewer$AbstractSearchJob.internalRun(TypeInfoViewer.java:571)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.dialogs.TypeInfoViewer$AbstractSearchJob.doRun(TypeInfoViewer.java:518)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.dialogs.TypeInfoViewer$AbstractJob.run(TypeInfoViewer.java:484)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

There is only 1 place that we put an indexLocation (IPath) into the table. I don't see how it could have been a string.

Aleksander - what other plugins do you have loaded?

How did you update your workspace?

I use eclipse links with *.link directory for plugin configuration. I deleted all org.eclipse.* data in platform configuration directory and restarted. Workspace has been initialized from scratch sometime after 3.2 release and JDT worked fine every milestone so far.

After the issue happened, I also removed all *.index and savedIndexNames.txt in .metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.core, but it didn't help.

Finally, this is extract from my platform.xml. I think only mylar and subclipse  could be problematic :

       <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/subclipse.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../subclipse/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/ve.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../ve/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/webtools.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../webtools/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/elbe.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../elbe/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/uml2.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../uml2/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/datatools.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../datatools/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/eodm.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../eodm/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/birt.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../birt/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="platform:/base/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/gef.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../gef/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/topcased.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../topcased/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/oaw.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../oaw/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/ext.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../ext/eclipse/">
</site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/mylar.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../mylar/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/emft.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../emft/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/emf.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../emf/eclipse/">
        </site>
        <site enabled="true" linkfile="/home/alex/lib/eclipse/platform/eclipse/links/gmf.link" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../gmf/eclipse/">

It looks like a WTP issue. After I disabled webtools, the bug disappeared and quickly appeared after I enabled it again. One of webtools indexers probably gets hold of indexLocations table and pushes Strings inside.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 174139 ***
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
